data.enText: your opposite number
a person who does the same job as you in another organization
data.chText: （另一个单位内）与自己职位相等的人

data.enText: The Foreign Secretary is currently having talks with his opposite number in the White House.
data.chText: 外交大臣现正和白宫的对等官员会谈。

data.enText: the opposite sex
the other sex
He found it difficult to talk to members of the opposite sex.
data.chText: 他觉得很难与异性交谈。

data.enText: pull in different/opposite directions
to have different aims that cannot be achieved together without causing problems
opposites attract
used to say that people who are very different are often attracted to each other

tr: a word that expresses a meaning opposed to the meaning of another word, in which case the two words are antonyms of each other
example: to him the antonym of `gay' was `depressed'

tr: a contestant that you are matched against

example: we thought Sue was older than Bill but just the reverse was true

tr: something inverted in sequence or character or effect
example: when the direct approach failed he tried the inverse

tr: growing in pairs on either side of a stem
example: opposite leaves
in diametric contradiction to his claims
diametrical (or opposite) points of view
opposite meanings
extreme and indefensible polar positions

tr: altogether different in nature or quality or significance
example: the medicine's effect was opposite to that intended
it is said that opposite characters make a union happiest"- Charles Read

tr: the other one of a complementary pair
example: the opposite sex
the two chess kings are set up on squares of opposite colors

tr: being directly across from each other
example: And I on the opposite shore will be, ready to ride and spread the alarm"- Longfello
we lived on opposite sides of the street
at opposite poles

tr: moving or facing away from each other
example: looking in opposite directions
they went in opposite directions
the two photographs lay face-to-face on the table
lived all their lives in houses face-to-face across the street
they sat opposite at the table

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap- 朝,向 + pet- 追求 + -ite 人/物

data.enText: on the other side of a particular area from sb/sth and usually facing them
Answers are given on the opposite page.
We live further down on the opposite side of the road.
data.chText: 我们住在马路对面再远一点的地方。

data.enText: It's not easy having a relationship when you live at opposite ends of the country.
data.chText: 人虽同国却各处东西；在这种情况下相好，谈何容易。

data.enText: facing the speaker or sb/sth that has been mentioned
I could see smoke coming from the windows of the house directly opposite.
data.chText: 我能看到烟从正对面的窗户里冒出来。

data.enText: He sat down in the chair opposite.
data.chText: 他在对面的椅子上坐了下来。

data.enText: as different as possible from sth
I watched them leave and then drove off in the opposite direction.
data.chText: 我目送他们离开，然后开车向相反的方向驶去。

data.enText: She tried calming him down but it seemed to be having the opposite effect.
data.chText: 她试着让他平静下来，却似乎火上浇油了。

data.enText: students at opposite ends of the ability range
There's a newly married couple living opposite (= on the other side of the road) .
data.chText: 有一对新婚夫妇住在马路对面。

data.enText: See opposite (= on the opposite page) for further details.
your opposite number
a person who does the same job as you in another organization
data.chText: （另一个单位内）与自己职位相等的人

data.enText: The Foreign Secretary is currently having talks with his opposite number in the White House.
data.chText: 外交大臣现正和白宫的对等官员会谈。

data.enText: the opposite sex
the other sex
He found it difficult to talk to members of the opposite sex.
data.chText: 他觉得很难与异性交谈。

data.enText: pull in different/opposite directions
to have different aims that cannot be achieved together without causing problems
a person or thing that is as different as possible from sb/sth else
data.chText: 对立的人（或物）；对立面；反面

data.enText: Hot and cold are opposites.
What is the opposite of heavy?
I thought she would be small and blonde but she's the complete opposite .
data.chText: 我原以为她是一位身材娇小的金发女郎，但她恰恰相反。

data.enText: Exactly the opposite is true.
‘Is it better now?’ ‘ Quite the opposite , I'm afraid.’
opposites attract
used to say that people who are very different are often attracted to each other
on the other side of a particular area from sb/sth, and usually facing them
I sat opposite him during the meal (= on the other side of the table) .
The bank is opposite the supermarket (= on the other side of the road) .
Write your address opposite (= next to) your name.
data.chText: 在姓名旁边写上你的地址。

data.enText: acting in a film/movie or play as the partner of sb
She starred opposite Tom Hanks.
data.chText: 她与汤姆∙汉克斯联袂主演。

ex.chText: 相反的论点／方向／效果／观点

ex.enText: Several of those present had contrary information.
ex.chText: 几个在场的人所掌握的信息截然不同。

ex.enText: That company's actions are contrary to the public interest.
ex.chText: 该公司的行为是与大众利益相悖的。

ex.enText: Contrary to popular opinion, I don't dye my hair!
ex.chText: 与大多数人的想法不同，我不染头发！

ex.enText: Contrary to our expectations, he's found a nice girlfriend.
ex.chText: 出乎我们的意料，他找到了一个漂亮的女友。

synonyms.bx: 指观点、意见、行为等完全相反或对立的；用于 contrary to popular belief等短语时，可作为句子状语；表示“逆向的”时尤指风，与converse同义。

ex.enText: He tried to make her happy but it seemed to be having the opposite effect.
ex.chText: 他试着哄她开心，却似乎适得其反了。

ex.enText: They drove off in the opposite direction.
ex.chText: 他们开车向相反方向驶去。

ex.enText: The result was quite opposite to what they had expected.
ex.chText: 结果和他们所期望的完全相反。

synonyms.bx: 与 contrary 基本同义，但通常只作定语，后接介词 to 时则可作表语。

example.ex: Jennie had sat opposite her at breakfast.
example.tran: 珍妮吃早餐时坐在她对面。

example.ex: He looked up at the buildings opposite, but could see no open window...
example.tran: 他抬头看向对面那些楼，但没有看见哪扇窗户开着。

example.ex: Melissa slid in beside Paula, and her husband sat opposite.
example.tran: 梅利莎悄悄溜进来坐在葆拉身边，她的丈夫在对面坐下。

gramarinfo.label: usu n ADV, ADV after v

value.def: If one thing is opposite another, it is on the other side of a space from it.
The opposite side or part of something is the side or part that is furthest away from you.

example.ex: All the cars driving in the opposite direction had their headlights on...
example.tran: 对面开来的车都打着头灯。

example.ex: I should have written the notes in the opposite order...
example.tran: 我本应按相反的顺序记笔记的。

example.ex: In fact everything he does is opposite to what is considered normal behaviour.
example.tran: 事实上，他的一切作为都和人们所认为的正常举动大相径庭。

gramarinfo.label: usu ADJ n, also v-link ADJ <l>to</l> n, v-link ADJ

value.def: Opposite is used to describe things of the same kind which are completely different in a particular way. For example, north and south are opposite directions, and winning and losing are opposite results in a game.
value.tran: （同一类事物）截然相反的，全然不同的

example.ex: Ritter was a very complex man but Marius was the opposite, a simple farmer...
example.tran: 里特城府颇深，而马里厄斯恰恰相反，是个心地淳朴的农民。

example.ex: Well, whatever he says you can bet he's thinking the opposite...
example.tran: 呃，不管他说什么，你都可以肯定他想的完全是另一套。
与白色相对的颜色是什么？

value.def: The opposite of someone or something is the person or thing that is most different from them.

trans: 恰恰相反；正好相反；反其道而行
对立的一方；对方；对方所；对方当事人
(其他部门、公司、组织中的)对等者，职务相同者，同级别者
